Next-generation JavaScript Client Frameworks / Libraries

March 7, 2015

The landscape of JavaScript frameworks / libraries is changing fast. What started out as way to handle the DOM better through declarative data binding has evolved into a competitive niche with Google and Facebook pitching contrasting ideas and un expected collaborations – a Angular 2 is built on TypeScript. So with ES6 on the horizon this is how it looking:

  • Angular 2.0
  • Aurelia
  • Ember.js

Now you are probably thinking where is React on that list. The guys at React say that it’s the V in MVC. But what does this mean for dynamic client UIs?

In the next couple of posts, I will explore this landscape with the intention of gaining a better understanding of where we may be heading. All I can say now is that will all these options, it’s a great time to be a client side developer.
